entry.title: Why We Stare At Eyes
entry.summary:
When we talk, see or watch someone we often stare them at their eyes. I believe there are three reasons for this.

  1. the color distinction of eyes is dominant compared to other parts of the face

    Our eyes have natural tendency of focusing at spots with greater color distinction. They either focus at too dark or at too light. Next time you focus on something evaluate how distinct it is from its surrounding.

  2. eyes have movement

    Eyes are good at spotting changes. They easily get distracted to a movement. Eyes and lips are the two parts that can move. That is why we tend to focus on eyes and lips when we talk.

  3. focusing at an eye our brain can get symmetry of entire face

    I would rather write an article on this topic in more generic approach.
